meta.disclaimer: Always verify details on official scholarship websites. Deadlines and amounts may change annually.

scholarships.name: Chevening Scholarship
scholarships.provider: UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office
requirements: Return to home country for 2 years
scholarships.tips: Leadership experience and clear career plan are crucial. Apply to 3 UK universities. Start your application early - essays take time.

scholarships.name: Fulbright Foreign Student Program
scholarships.tips: Apply through your country's Fulbright Commission. Smaller Balkan countries often face less competition. Strong emphasis on cultural exchange.

scholarships.name: Gates Cambridge Scholarship
requirements: Commitment to improving lives of others
scholarships.tips: Two-thirds of awards go to PhD students. The 500-word Gates Statement is crucial - focus on your impact vision. Average successful applicant GPA is 3.92/4.0.

scholarships.name: Rhodes Scholarship (Global)
scholarships.tips: Only 2 Global Rhodes awards per year for non-constituency countries. Extremely competitive. Focus on character, leadership, and service to others.

scholarships.name: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees
scholarships.tips: Partner Country students (non-EU Balkans) get priority - 75% of scholarships reserved for them. Apply to multiple programs (max 3). Croatia as EU member has lower priority.

scholarships.name: DAAD Scholarships
requirements: German B1 for German programs or English proficiency for English programs
scholarships.tips: Germany has no tuition fees at public universities - DAAD covers living costs. Many English-taught Master's programs available. EPOS program excludes Western Balkans - apply to general scholarships instead.

scholarships.name: Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Must secure acceptance from Swiss professor first. Very bureaucratic process - start early. Contact Swiss embassy in your country for exact deadlines.

scholarships.name: Eiffel Excellence Scholarship
scholarships.provider: French Ministry of Foreign Affairs / Campus France
requirements: Must be nominated by French institution
scholarships.tips: You cannot apply directly - must be nominated by a French university. Apply to French universities first and ask them to nominate you. Sciences Po and top business schools frequently nominate candidates.

scholarships.name: Stipendium Hungaricum
requirements: Must be nominated by home country ministry
scholarships.tips: Excellent option for Balkan students - regional priority. Must apply through your country's nominating authority (typically Ministry of Education). 600+ programs available across all disciplines.

scholarships.name: Türkiye Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Very open to Balkan applicants due to historical ties. Includes free 1-year Turkish language training. One of the most comprehensive scholarship packages globally.

scholarships.name: MEXT Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Two tracks: Embassy recommendation (apply at Japanese embassy) and University recommendation (apply directly to universities). Embassy track is more competitive but has more spots.

scholarships.name: Korean Government Scholarship (KGSP/GKS)
requirements: Both applicant and parents must not hold Korean citizenship
scholarships.tips: TOEFL not required but gives bonus points. TOPIK Level 5+ exempts from language training. Includes comprehensive 1-year Korean language program before degree studies.

scholarships.name: Chinese Government Scholarship (CSC)
scholarships.tips: 279 Chinese universities participate. Can choose Chinese-taught (HSK required) or English-taught programs. Apply through Chinese embassy or directly to universities.

scholarships.name: Schwarzman Scholars
scholarships.tips: Looking for future global leaders with China interest. 35% of cohort from outside US/China. One-year Master's in Global Affairs at Tsinghua University, Beijing.

scholarships.name: Vanier Canada Graduate Scholarships
requirements: Must be nominated by Canadian university
scholarships.tips: Cannot apply directly - must be nominated by a Canadian university. Apply to universities first and request nomination. Approximately 166 awards annually across all fields.

scholarships.name: Holland Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Partial funding only - €5,000 helps but need additional funding. Combine with university-specific scholarships. Croatia NOT eligible (EU member).

scholarships.name: Konrad Adenauer Stiftung Scholarship
scholarships.tips: German political foundation scholarship. Must demonstrate commitment to democracy, rule of law, and social engagement. Strong interview component.

scholarships.name: Friedrich Ebert Stiftung Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Social democratic political foundation. Emphasize social justice, equality, and democratic engagement in application. Two application windows: May and November.

scholarships.name: CEEPUS Network Scholarship

deadline.note: Aug 31 winter, Oct 31 summer, Nov 30 freemovers

scholarships.tips: Excellent for semester exchanges in Central Europe. Network mobility (within partnerships) or Freemover (independent). Host countries: Austria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Slovakia, Slovenia, and all Balkans.

scholarships.name: Visegrad Scholarship Program
scholarships.tips: Specifically for Western Balkans students studying in Visegrad 4 countries. Croatia NOT eligible. €3,500/semester helps significantly with living costs.

scholarships.name: Western Balkans-Visegrad Fellowships
scholarships.tips: Short-term research fellowship (2-10 weeks). Excellent for PhD research stays. €500/week is very competitive rate.

scholarships.name: Ernst Mach Grant (OeAD)

fundingDetails.tuition: Tuition at most Austrian universities is low/free

scholarships.tips: Specifically targets CEEPUS member countries including all Western Balkans. €1,300/month is excellent for Austria. Multiple deadline windows.

scholarships.name: Polish NAWA Stefan Banach Programme
scholarships.provider: Polish National Agency for Academic Exchange (NAWA)
scholarships.tips: Western Balkans gets PRIORITY consideration. Croatia NOT eligible. Includes Polish language course. STEM fields particularly welcomed.

scholarships.name: Italian Government Scholarship (MAECI)
scholarships.tips: Total funding ~€9,000 covers basics. Italian universities have relatively low fees. Good option combined with university merit scholarships. Must apply through Italian embassy.

scholarships.name: Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship
scholarships.tips: For development professionals. Western Balkans eligibility may be limited (upper-middle income classification). Verify current status. Must commit to returning home after studies.

scholarships.name: Oxford Clarendon Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Automatically considered when applying to Oxford. About 140 awards per year across all departments. No separate application - based on graduate application strength.

scholarships.name: Oxford Weidenfeld-Hoffmann Scholarship
scholarships.tips: For students from emerging economies. Must demonstrate commitment to returning and contributing to home country. Includes leadership development program at Oxford.

scholarships.name: Cambridge Trust Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Automatically considered when applying to Cambridge. Can be combined with college funding. PhD students have higher success rate.

scholarships.name: Imperial College President's PhD Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top STEM scholarship in UK. 50 awards annually across science, engineering, medicine. International fee coverage is rare - makes this exceptionally valuable.

scholarships.name: LSE Graduate Support Scheme
scholarships.tips: Awards range from £5,000 to full tuition. Need-based component. LSE is top for social sciences, economics, international relations. Apply early.

scholarships.name: Edinburgh Global Master's Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Multiple scholarship schemes available. Combine different awards to increase funding. Edinburgh is strong across most disciplines with good international community.

scholarships.name: Bristol Think Big Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Tiered awards based on merit. Higher awards for outstanding candidates. Strong research university with good industry connections.

scholarships.name: Warwick Chancellor's International Scholarship
scholarships.tips: 30 awards annually. Full international fee coverage is rare. Warwick is top 10 UK university. Strong in business, economics, engineering, sciences.

scholarships.name: UCL Global Master's Scholarship
scholarships.tips: £15,000 is significant contribution. UCL is top 10 globally. Strong across all disciplines. London location offers great career opportunities.

scholarships.name: Knight-Hennessy Scholars
scholarships.tips: Most valuable graduate scholarship globally (~$300,000). 48% of cohort is international. Apply to Stanford program AND Knight-Hennessy separately. Video statement required.

scholarships.name: ETH Zurich Excellence Scholarship (ESOP)
scholarships.tips: ETH Zurich is #1 in continental Europe for STEM. CHF 12,000/semester is excellent for Swiss costs. Highly competitive - need near-perfect academics.

scholarships.name: EPFL Excellence Fellowship
scholarships.provider: EPFL (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne)
scholarships.tips: EPFL is among top 15 globally for STEM. French-speaking area but Master's in English. Beautiful campus on Lake Geneva. Combined with low Swiss tuition, makes study affordable.

scholarships.name: Sciences Po Émile Boutmy Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Sciences Po is #1 in Europe for political science. Tiered awards based on merit. Croatia NOT eligible (EU member). Paris location is expensive but scholarship helps significantly.

scholarships.name: Bocconi Merit Awards
scholarships.tips: Top business school in Italy, top 10 in Europe. Full tuition waiver for top applicants. Milan location offers great career opportunities. Early application recommended.

scholarships.name: Central European University (CEU) Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Excellent for Western Balkans students - regional focus. Vienna location. Strong in social sciences, human rights, public policy. Most students receive some funding.

scholarships.name: TU Delft Justus & Louise van Effen Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top technical university in Netherlands, top 20 globally for engineering. ~€60,000 total value over 2 years. Highly competitive - need near-perfect grades.

scholarships.name: Leiden University Excellence Scholarship (LExS)
scholarships.tips: Oldest university in Netherlands. Strong in humanities, law, sciences. Tiered awards - highest performers get most funding. The Hague campus for international law/relations.

scholarships.name: Utrecht Excellence Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top research university in Netherlands. Full funding including living costs is rare. Beautiful historic city. Strong across all disciplines.

scholarships.name: Maastricht University High Potential Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Problem-Based Learning (PBL) teaching method. Strong international focus. €34,000-36,000 total value. Includes visa and travel - very comprehensive.

scholarships.name: Generation Google Scholarship (EMEA)
scholarships.tips: For women pursuing computer science in Europe, Middle East, Africa. €7,000 helps with expenses. Good networking opportunity with Google.

scholarships.name: Schlumberger Foundation Faculty for the Future
scholarships.tips: Excellent option for women in STEM from Balkans. Up to $50,000/year. Must commit to returning home to contribute to STEM education. Study at top universities worldwide.

scholarships.name: L'Oréal-UNESCO For Women in Science
scholarships.tips: International Awards (€100,000) are extremely competitive. Regional/national awards (€15,000) more accessible. Focus on life and physical sciences. Great for visibility and networking.

scholarships.name: Rotary Peace Fellowship
scholarships.tips: Study at Rotary Peace Centers: Duke/UNC, Uppsala, Queensland, ICU Tokyo, Makerere, Chulalongkorn. 50 Master's fellowships annually. Must apply through local Rotary club.

scholarships.name: AAUW International Fellowship
scholarships.tips: For women pursuing graduate study in US. Stipend helps with living costs. Can be combined with other funding. Strong alumni network.

scholarships.name: Forté Foundation MBA Fellowship
scholarships.tips: 50+ partner business schools worldwide. Average award $25,000. Indicates strong commitment to women in business leadership. Good networking opportunities.

scholarships.name: Swedish Institute Leader Lab
scholarships.tips: Alternative to main SI scholarship (which excludes Balkans). Short leadership programs in Sweden. Great for networking with other emerging leaders. Croatia NOT eligible.

scholarships.name: Harvard Kennedy School Public Policy Fellowships
scholarships.tips: HKS offers many fellowships for international students. Need-based aid meets full demonstrated need. Focus on public service career goals in application.

scholarships.name: Columbia University Fellowships
scholarships.tips: PhD programs fully funded across most departments. Master's funding more limited but available. NYC location offers unparalleled opportunities. Ivy League prestige.

scholarships.name: Yale University Fellowships
scholarships.tips: All PhD students receive full funding for 5+ years. Professional schools have varying aid. World-class faculty and resources. Strong humanities and sciences.

scholarships.name: MIT Graduate Fellowships
scholarships.tips: All PhD students fully funded. Most Master's self-funded unless in research-based programs. World #1 for technology and engineering. Very competitive admission.

scholarships.name: Berkeley Graduate Fellowships
scholarships.tips: Top public university globally. PhD funding guaranteed. San Francisco Bay Area location. Strong across STEM, social sciences, humanities. Diverse international community.

scholarships.name: NYU Graduate Scholarships
scholarships.tips: PhD programs fully funded. Master's funding competitive. NYC location expensive but offers amazing opportunities. Strong in arts, business, law, social sciences.

scholarships.name: Manchester Global Futures Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Major UK research university. Good value in northern England (lower cost than London). Strong in sciences, engineering, business. Multiple scholarship rounds available.

scholarships.name: INSEAD MBA Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Top global MBA (1-year program). Campuses in France, Singapore, Abu Dhabi. Average scholarship €23,700. 50+ scholarship types. European diversity scholarship may apply.

scholarships.name: London Business School Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Top European business school. London location is expensive but offers unparalleled finance/consulting opportunities. Many corporate-sponsored scholarships available.

scholarships.name: Czech Government Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Public university education free in Czech language. Scholarship covers living. Prague and other cities very affordable. Good option for EU access while studying.

scholarships.name: Hungarian Government Bilateral Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Based on bilateral agreements with Balkan countries. Apply through Ministry of Education in home country. Good regional option with lower competition.

scholarships.name: Norwegian Quota Scheme (Closed - Historical)
scholarships.tips: IMPORTANT: This program was discontinued in 2016. Norwegian public universities still have no tuition for all students (including international), but no living cost support. Self-fund living expenses (~NOK 12,000/month needed).

scholarships.name: Finnish Government Scholarship Pool
scholarships.tips: For doctoral research visits, not full degrees. Must have Finnish supervisor/host. Finland charges tuition for non-EU students (€8,000-18,000/year for degrees).

scholarships.name: Danish Government Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Limited spots available. Danish universities have high tuition for non-EU (€8,000-21,000/year). Copenhagen is expensive but excellent quality of life. Strong in design, sustainability.

scholarships.name: Belgian VLIR-UOS Scholarships
scholarships.tips: ICP (International Course Programme) scholarships. Development-focused programs. Must commit to return home. Croatia NOT eligible. Strong programs in agriculture, health, engineering.

scholarships.name: Spanish Government Scholarships (AECID)
scholarships.provider: Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation
scholarships.tips: Many programs require Spanish B2. English-taught programs limited. Spain has lower living costs than northern Europe. Beautiful country with great quality of life.

scholarships.name: Irish Government Scholarships (GOI-IES)
scholarships.tips: 60 scholarships annually. English-speaking country - no language barrier. Strong tech sector (Google, Meta, Microsoft HQs). Post-study work visa available.

scholarships.name: University of Groningen Talent Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Tiered system: higher academic merit = more funding. Top 100 university globally. Beautiful historic city with high student population. Lower costs than Amsterdam/Rotterdam.

scholarships.name: Lund University Global Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top university in Sweden. Since main SI scholarship excludes Balkans, this is best Swedish option. Apply through University Admissions Sweden portal. Beautiful medieval city.

scholarships.name: Uppsala University Scholarships
scholarships.tips: Oldest university in Scandinavia (founded 1477). Strong in sciences and humanities. Swedish tuition ~SEK 90,000-145,000/year - waiver valuable. Historic university town near Stockholm.

scholarships.name: KTH Royal Institute of Technology Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top technical university in Sweden. Full tuition + living costs is exceptional value. Stockholm location with strong tech industry. Very competitive - need stellar grades.

scholarships.name: TU Munich Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top technical university in Germany (top 50 globally). No tuition at German public universities. Various scholarship programs available. Munich expensive but great quality of life.

scholarships.name: Deutschlandstipendium
scholarships.tips: Available at most German universities. €300/month helps with living costs. Combined with free tuition, makes Germany very affordable. Apply through your German university.

scholarships.name: Heinrich Böll Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Green political foundation. Strong focus on sustainability, democracy, human rights, gender equality. Must demonstrate alignment with green values. Two application windows annually.

scholarships.name: Rosa Luxemburg Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Left-wing political foundation. Focus on social justice, anti-discrimination, democratic socialism. Must demonstrate political engagement and alignment with foundation values.

scholarships.name: Hans Böckler Foundation Scholarship
requirements: Trade union engagement or working-class background
scholarships.tips: Trade union foundation. Prioritizes students from non-academic families or with working-class backgrounds. Focus on labor rights and social democracy.

scholarships.name: Avicenna Foundation Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Muslim student foundation. Supports Muslim students in Germany regardless of nationality. Focus on academic excellence and social responsibility.

scholarships.name: WU Vienna Excellence Scholarship
scholarships.provider: Vienna University of Economics and Business
scholarships.tips: Top business school in Austria. Vienna is excellent city for quality of life. €4,000/semester + tuition waiver is strong package. Strong industry connections.

scholarships.name: University of Vienna Excellence Award
scholarships.tips: Large comprehensive university in Vienna. Many English-taught Master's programs. Vienna is affordable compared to other Western European capitals. Good quality of life.

scholarships.name: Ghent University Top-Up Grants
scholarships.tips: Top university in Belgium. €10,000/year grant helps with tuition (~€6,000) and living costs. Ghent is beautiful, student-friendly city. Strong in sciences and engineering.

scholarships.name: KU Leuven Science@Leuven Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Top university in Belgium (top 50 globally). For Science Master's programs specifically. Full tuition + €10,200 living is excellent package. Very competitive.

scholarships.name: Delft Excellence Scholarship
scholarships.tips: Different from van Effen (which includes living). This covers tuition only but still valuable. Can combine with other funding. Top engineering school.

scholarships.name: Amsterdam Excellence Scholarship (AES)
scholarships.tips: Top university in Amsterdam. Full tuition + €500/month living support. Amsterdam is expensive but vibrant international city. Strong across all disciplines.

scholarships.name: VU Amsterdam Fellowship Programme
scholarships.tips: Full funding at top Amsterdam university. €11,000/year + tuition makes study affordable. VU strong in social sciences, humanities, sciences. Amsterdam location.
